newsitem.title: USA: Bio-Dyne to reorganize, discontinue units.
newsitem.headline: Bio-Dyne to reorganize, discontinue units.

text.p: Bio-Dyne Corp said Friday that it will restructure and discontinue its Home Fitness Studios and Carolina Fitness Equipment units.

Bio-Dyne said its board is also reviewing other options, including the sale of its manufacturing operation, a merger with a company involved in the fitness industry, and a possible acquisition unrelated to the fitness industry.
The company did not comment on the cost of the reorganization.
Bio-Dyne, which makes home gyms and exercise products, said it tried to recapitalize the two subsidiaries with the help of vendors and existing shareholders.

However, the reluctance on the part of the vendors to provide additional credit to purchase products or to restructure the liabilities of Home Fitness and Carolina Fitness led to the the decision to discontinue the units.

Last year, the two subsidiaries lost over $2 million and through June 30, 1996, the units continued to lose significant money, customers and orders as vendors refused to provide additional credit, Bio-Dyne said.
